messages.title: Fighting for a fairer deal in West Ham
messages.content: May's General Election is the most important in decades. This Tory-led Government has decimated Newham Council's budget, the NHS is at breaking point and people are on average £1,600 a year worse off. We live in a country deeply divided between the 'Haves' and the 'Have-Nots'...

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase the Minimum Wage to £8 an hour and provide 25 hours of free childcare for working parents.
Campaign to save NHS services at Newham General Hospital and improve access to GPs in West Ham.
Scrap the Bedroom Tax, ban rip off letting agent fees, and stop excessive rent rises.
Labour’s plan puts working families first and saves our NHS by providing a £2.5 billion-a-year Time to Care Fund which will pay for 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs.

issues.economy: This Tory-led Government has... people are on average £1,600 a year worse off.
issues.governance: This Tory-led Government has decimated Newham Council's budget...
issues.socialWelfare: Labour’s plan puts working families first...

housing.content: Scrap the Bedroom Tax, ban rip off letting agent fees, and stop excessive rent rises.

images.caption: Photo of Lyn Brown, Labour candidate for West Ham.
